intro: Navia trichodonta, commonly known as the hairy navia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Navia trichodonta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
